prompt:
I have the following gene expression data, "leukemiaExp.txt". The file is tab separated. The table has gene names on the first column. Each row is a gene and each column is a distinct sample. Filter genes based on their variability so we retain the most variable top 1000 genes. Based on these variable genes, plot a heatmap with clustering. Also plot PCA for samples.

response:
```
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(pheatmap)
library(gplots)
library(heatmaply)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(ape)
library(gridExtra)

# Read the gene expression data
data <- read.table("leukemiaExp.txt", sep="\t", header=TRUE, row.names=1)

# Calculate the variance of each gene
variances <- apply(data, 1, var)

# Sort the genes based on their variance and select the top 1000 most variable genes
top_1000_genes <- head(order(variances, decreasing=TRUE), 1000)

# Subset the data to include only the top 1000 most variable genes
filtered_data <- data[top_1000_genes, ]

# Perform clustering on the filtered data
cluster_data <- t(filtered_data)
distance_matrix <- dist(cluster_data)
cluster_result <- hclust(distance_matrix)
heatmap_data <- cluster_data[rev(cluster_result$order), ]

# Plot the heatmap with clustering
heatmap(heatmap_data, col = heat.colors(256), scale="row")

# Perform PCA on the filtered data
pca_data <- prcomp(t(filtered_data))

# Plot the PCA for samples
plot(pca_data$x[,1], pca_data$x[,2], xlab="PC1", ylab="PC2")

```
